name: Captain's Bounty on the Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have frequented the Captain's Bounty Motor Inn at least twice a year for the last three years, and have never had a bad experience.
reviews.title: The Only Place We Stay
Wonderful place
reviews.text: Tim, the owner, is a great guy and is always willing to help when we have questions, or if we just want to chat about the Red Sox.

The rooms are all very nice, and good sized. The mattresses are comfortable, and the bathrooms are adequate. The location is very convenient, and most of the time we park our car when we get there and don't use it again until after we check out. While parking is tight, it's not impossible to manuever.
reviews.title: My favorite

likes.disliked: — It's pricey but I feel it's still worth it.

reviews.text: What keeps us coming back to the Captain's Bounty is the view! There is nothing more relaxing than sitting out on your own private balcony with a book and listening to the water crash just a few feet away.
reviews.title: Great, friendly place

likes.disliked: — No ironing board/iron/hair dryer in the room. Bring your own.

reviews.title: Favorite Family Gathering Place
reviews.text: The only recommendation I have is to stay away from the Beach Street Bistro (owned by the same folks as the Captain's Bounty - they will sometimes give you a menu upon check-in). The food is expensive, and awful. I had the worst clam chowder ever there (it was water with potatoes basically).

reviews.title: relaxation
reviews.text: What a wonderful stay...Captain's Bounty is right in the center of everything. We parked our car and walked every where we went. We had wonderful weather and the beach was full of people. The rooms are right on the beach. The sound of the waves is so relaxing. The towels were big and fluffy and all rooms had a refrig and microwave so helpful. But most of all the rooms have all been done over and with such taste. Our room was a soft yellow with new furniture and new beds. We slept so peacefully. The rooms were so clean. The staff couldn't of been more helpful. They are always willing to go out of their way to guide you around town. The town of Rockport has such beauty.

We have stayed at the Inn the for multiple summers -with the 'old' owner, and the 'new.' Our most recent stay, 8/2005 was very disappointing. While the rooms have been 'updated' there are still multiple issues that the owner has neglected. The bugs - centipedes etc all over balcony & room; bedding is only changed every 3 days - we slept with sand every night. While the balcony provides a spectacular view of the ocean, all of the chairs on our balcony were broken. We have also found that the 'new owner' is not very 'kid friendly.' The room's were 'OK' as far as cleanliness - could of been much better. Be aware if you are located on the first floor - dog hair and water from plants continually 'drops' from the upper floors, onto front sidewalk. The owner, Tim, was very unprofessional and condescending when these issues were presented to him. Unfortunately, we have ended our 'yearly trip' to the Inn. We have already made reservations at another establishment for next summer. Rockport however, is a fantastic area to vacation!
reviews.title: Disappointing stay 2005

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here one night. We were in #37, a corner oceanfront efficiency. It was on the third floor (reserved for adults only - nice) and was accessible by outside stairways at the center and ends of the building. The unit was very clean including the frig and microwave; and recently remodeled as mentioned by other reviewers. The property has a small sandy beach and is a very short walk from Bearskin Neck. The view of the ocean from the small balconies is spectacular.
reviews.title: Non-smokers take note
New Owner-Totally redone, wonderful spot to vacation
reviews.text: While all this sounds good, if you are a non-smoker, beware! Smoking is not allowed in the rooms, but is permitted on the balconies, which are incredibly small - perhaps no more than five feet in length and separated from adjacent units by only small metal railings. If guests in adjacent rooms are chain smokers, as ours were, you may be forced to vacate your balcony and close your patio doors. Although there was no A/C, the cool breeze would have been very pleasant with the patio door open. However, if we opened the door we had to deal with the second-hand smoke that permeated our room. If you suffer from asthma, emphysema, or allergies, look for another place to stay.

Overall it was a nice place. The staff was very friendly and helpful. When we followup after our trip with an email to the motel, the owner responded to us apologizing and indicating that he is re-thinking his entire smoking policy.
reviews.title: Newly Remodelled and a GREAT value!!
Could have been better
reviews.text: My family of four just spent five nights at this hotel. While at a great location, our stay could have been better. The person who made our reservation booked us in the middle of a family reunion, so that we had people on either side of us crossing over our balcony to visit with one another. In addition, the parking was terrible. With a limited number of spaces, we once had to drive our vehicle over the curb to fit in to a small spot left after a van with a hitch took up almost two spaces. There was also no air conditioning, which I didn't know about until we arrived and found one desk fan for the entire room. I think it's about time the hotel started putting some of the money they make back into updating their rooms.

aka: Captain`s Bounty On The Beach Hotel
description: We are an oceanfront hotel in beautiful downtown Rockport -- all of our rooms have decks and face directly onto the Atlantic Ocean. The beach is entered from the side of our building. All of Rockport's shops, art galleries and restaurants are within an easy walk. Our rooms have cable TV with DVD players and Wi-Fi. Nine of our rooms have complete kitchenettes and all rooms have been extensively renovated over the last few years.
